Description: Lower body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed with two added red lines on white band; exterior slipped cream: three friezes separated by bands with added red band: above, animals to right (front hoof, and lower part of striding bird with incised tail); centre, metopal frieze of squares and star rosettes separated by triple verticals; below, lotus flower and bud frieze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.192)
